subject: Business
title: The Leader's Shadow: Culture Starts With You
description: A 60-second lesson on The Leader's Shadow: Culture Starts With You.

hook.text: A CEO says 'work-life balance matters' while sending emails at midnight every night. The emails speak louder.

buildup.text: Leaders cast a shadow: their behavior, habits, and values are amplified and replicated throughout the organization.

discovery.text: If a leader cuts corners, the organization learns that cutting corners is acceptable.

twist.text: The shadow effect means leaders are always 'on.' Even casual remarks become policy when spoken by the boss.

climax.text: Ray Dalio made 'radical transparency' real at Bridgewater by recording every meeting â€” including his own mistakes.

punchline.text: Your team doesn't follow your words. They follow your behavior.

quiz.question: What is the 'leader's shadow' concept?
options: A leader's behavior is amplified and replicated throughout the organization
Leaders should work in the background without visibility
Only negative behaviors are noticed by employees
